title: Directory Listing from 1881
content:
Hi I was wondering what this typeface is for this laundry directory from the year 1881. Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [directory1881.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/typophile.com/files/directory1881.jpg) | 107.02 KB |

 [‹ Popbot Bauhaus-like geometric sans cover type](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30197 "Go to previous forum topic") [Baskerville/Caslon??? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30187 "Go to next forum topic")
author: blueanxiety

comments.content: It’s a well-worn text font of the era. You might try [Scotch Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/www.linotype.com/13498/scotchroman-font.html) or [Excelsior](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/www.linotype.com/387/excelsior-family.html).
It’s not an exact match, but [De Vinne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202144420/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/de-vinne/) is in the same vein.
